SignalsLink
Expands the Signals mod with additional components.

Block Sensor
Allows detecting the presence of a block at a selected adjacent position and, based on the input signal, determining how full its inventory slots are.
The input signal determines which slot should be scanned.
Signals 1–14 correspond to slots 0–13. The output is information about the slot’s fill level relative to the maximum stack capacity of the item in that slot, converted to a 0–15 signal.
Signal 15 indicates that the sensor should detect the block state based on what kind of block it is.
Currently supported blocks are:
Chest or any general container – the output signal corresponds to the total fullness of the container.
Any blocks that have inventory slots (e.g., firepit, barrel, etc.). The output is a signal according to the input signal; see the description above.
Anvil – if there is a sufficiently hot ingot on the anvil ready for forging, the Output is signal 1. Otherwise it sends signal 0.
